executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency.

The Online Flower Shops industry retails flowers online using local florists to fulfill orders. Over the past five years, the industry experienced steady revenue, aided by a growing e-commerce market which helped capture significant market share from brick-and-mortar florists as more consumers shop online. Additionally, a healthy economy supported growth as per capita disposable income and consumer spending increased, boosting demand for flowers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Online Flower Shops industry revenue has been growing
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Online Flower Shops industry revenue has been growing at an annualized 14.5% over the past five years – including an estimated 4.7% surge in the current year – and is expected to total $16.3 billion in 2023, with profit margins set to reach 8.4%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Downstream demand is susceptible to income changes
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The purchase of flowers, gift baskets and other products, is sensitive to disposable income level, consumer spending level and overall consumer confidence.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Online Flower Shops industry revenue is expected to grow
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Online Flower Shops industry revenue is expected to grow at an annualized 2.2% to $18.2 billion over the five years to 2028, when profit margins are estimated to climb to 7.9%.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Inflation is Detrimental to Industry Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although consumer spending will increase, consumers may still exercise caution while buying flowers due to uncertainty resulting from rising inflation. Consumers will search for discounted products and increasingly turn to the Internet to find deals on flowers and gifts.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Internal and External Competition Will Remain High
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The consumer market for flowers and gifts is highly competitive since consumers can buy these products from many sources, like traditional local retail florists and mass merchants.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The External Competition Will Stem From Amazon's Online Flower Market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although the company currently has limited floral arrangements and delivery options, shipping is free. Amazon's business model encourages consumers to buy floral arrangements on impulse with other purchases in different product lines.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: As Per Capita Disposable Income Increases, Demand for Flowers Will Increase Accordingly
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising demand will encourage all flower retailers to expand into e-commerce to increase their consumer pool, effectively entering them into the industry.

industry_definition: This industry retails flowers online, with industry operators receiving orders and payments through respective websites and then using either a network of local florists or growers to fulfill and deliver the order. This industry primarily includes revenue from fresh-cut flowers, floral arrangements and potted plants; internet florist network membership dues; and gift baskets sold online. Revenue from in-person orders is excluded from this report.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: The industry has benefited from increases in the number of services conducted online
The industry has been able to quickly adapt to changing opportunities
External competition will stem from Amazon adding flowers to its product portfolio
Both internal and external competition will remain high for the industry
As per capita disposable income increases, demand for flowers will likely increase also
Over the past five years, an increase in the number of industry operators has increased internal competition

market_segmentation.segment_description: As a technologically savvy generation, this consumer segment is prone to turning to the Internet for shopping needs, which increases the segment's share of industry demand.
Consumers in this age demographic typically have stable jobs with a consistent source of income, which increases the propensity to buy discretionary products such as flowers.
Consumers in this age range tend to be more emotionally connected to flowers and generally buy flowers as a traditional holiday or special occasion gift.

products_and_services.product_description: Bouquets made from various flowers, such as roses, lilies, orchids, tulips and daisies.
Unarranged cut flowers are typically purchased for self-arrangement at homes.
Online flower shops provide potted plants, which include orchids, gardenias and bonsai trees.
Gift baskets may include candy, chocolates, popcorn, stuffed animals, fruits and other food.
The larger online flower shops provide services that facilitate the order exchange and fulfillment between local florists and third-party sales agents.

tier_1_suppliers: Plant & Flower Growing in the US
E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
tier_2_buyers: Flower & Nursery Stock Wholesaling in the US
Nursery & Garden Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for Online Flower Shops industry products is tied closely to disposable income.
The industry is affected by the number of individuals with internet connections.
Fluctuations in flower prices are a significant demand determinant.
Demand for flowers has swung to supermarkets for lower prices.
Demand for flowers is largely seasonal.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Online Flower Shops industry does not participate in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest proportion of any region.
THE WEST IS THE SECOND-LARGEST REGION BY ESTABLISHMENTS.
THE MID-ATLANTIC AND THE GREAT LAKES ARE THE THIRD- AND FOURTH-POPULAR DESTINATIONS FOR ONLINE FLOWER SHOPS.
THE MID-ATLANTIC AND THE GREAT LAKES ARE THE THIRD- AND FOURTH-POPULAR DESTINATIONS FOR ONLINE FLOWER SHOPS.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Currently, businesses are only required to collect sales tax if they have a physical presence.
Floral retail regulations are enacted on the state level.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low and steady.
Competition level is high and steady.

factors_decreased_barrier: Regulation level is light and steady
Globalization level is low but increasing

basis_points.basis_description: Online flower shops compete based on location, price, quality, website quality, customer service and products.
Online flower shops compete with brick-and-mortar retailers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has a low level of market share concentration.
The industry's two largest companies have made acquisitions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Industry Profit is Higher than the Retail Sector's Due to Online Stores' Lower Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Companies pay less for rent and utilities.
The profit percentage has been steadily increasing over the years.
Wages make up a small share of industry revenue.
Purchase expenses' revenue share has declined due to the removal of tariffs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Online Flower Shops industry has a high level of capital intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility depends on consumer trends.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators have benefited from computer-literate generations.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators specialize in selling flowers.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge?
FAQs.answer: Some industry operators focus on hiring well-trained florists.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Some of the industry's largest players have invested heavily in acquisitions.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology, such as RFID tags, etc., in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators must keep pace with new technology updates.
